title: Grab this $399 Bambu Lab P1S 3D printer, back down to a record-low price for the new year save $300 on high-speed enclosed printer for beginners and enthusiasts alike
summary: The Bambu Lab P1S 3D printer is back down to an all-time low price of $399.99.

title: Intel's upcoming Arc B770 discrete GPU leaks out on GitHub, launch appears imminent
summary: Intel's Arc B770 graphics card is reportedly close to release, featuring the BMG-G31 GPU, 16GB+ VRAM, 32 Xe2 cores, and a 300W TDP.

title: Samsung teases AI OLED Cassette and Turntable display division stretches the feasible use cases for its latest tech at CES 2026
summary: Samsung is teasing new OLED products to be showcased at CES 2026.

title: Speed test pits six generations of Windows against each other
summary: Windows 11 performed poorly against five previous Windows versions in a speed test, placing last in most benchmarks.

title: Blu-ray hits 20 years old, and it isn't dead yet
summary: 20 years ago, Blu-ray technology, players, and media were introduced at CES in Las Vegas, and the format remains alive.

title: German retail supplier allegedly rationing RTX 5070 GPUs
summary: A German retailer claims their supplier is limiting RTX 5070 GPU deliveries to 5 units per model, with more powerful models unavailable.

title: PC Fan Faceoff: Can Arctic's $7 P12 Pro compete with the $40 Noctua NF-A12x25 G2?
summary: The article compares the Arctic P12 Pro, priced at $7, with the Noctua NF-A12x25 G2, priced at $40, in a head-to-head review.

title: US Army tests 20,000W vehicle-mounted laser systems for drone defense   updated LOCUST device is now more lethal against drones
summary: The U.S. Army is testing a more lethal 20kW vehicle-mounted LOCUST laser weapon system from AeroVironment (AV) Inc.

title: Microsoft silently kills Windows and Office phone activation and forces online activation with a Microsoft account
summary: Microsoft is now forcing online activation with a Microsoft account, redirecting users to an online portal, even for older unsupported builds.

title: Intel Arc B570 GPU kicks off new year at just $199 save $30 on one of the best budget GPUs around
summary: Sparkle's Arc B570 Guardian OC dual-fan graphics card is on sale for 13%, bringing its price down to $199.99 on Amazon.

title: MSI s RTX 5090 Lightning shatters GPU records before launch
summary: The MSI RTX 5090 Lightning has broken several benchmark records, reportedly with 40-phase VRAM and dual 12V-2x6 connectors. The GPU is expected to be announced on January 5 at CES 2026. Its overclocking capabilities have generated significant interest.

title: Gigabyte unleashes new DDR4 AM4 motherboards as RAM shortage continues to slam PC builders sky-high DDR5 prices spark rush for affordable alternatives
summary: Gigabyte has launched four new AM4 motherboard variants supporting DDR4 as consumers turn to affordable alternatives due to soaring DDR5 prices.

title: Corsair cancels $240 48GB DDR5 memory kit orders due to pricing error
summary: Corsair cancelled orders for a $240 48GB DDR5 memory kit due to a pricing error. The company claims the memory is out of stock. Customers are upset with the decision.

title: Corsair reverses course and honors gaming PC order after $700 price hike uproar
summary: A customer's order was canceled and the price was increased by $700, but Corsair rectified the situation by sending a discount coupon to honor the original price.

title: Turtle Beach Burst II Pro Review: Ultra-light, 8K polling, and a little creaky
summary: Turtle Beach's Burst II Pro is an ultra-lightweight wireless mouse with 8K polling rates and a unique DPI switch button. It's designed for gaming, but not necessarily edge AI, semiconductors, or other technology related topics. The mouse's ultra-lightweight design and high polling rates make it suitable for gamers who want a responsive experience.

title: Plasma-powered solid-state laptop cooler to debut at CES
summary: YPlasma has developed a new solid-state cooling solution using corona discharge to generate airflow without moving parts, with a live demo at CES 2026.

title: Laser cutting and engraving from a software perspective  master your hardware and optimize your creative output with some software know-how
summary: We take a closer look at the software side of laser cutting and engraving.

title: Samsung Display finally brings V-Stripe subpixel layout to QD-OLED  mass production of new 1,300-nit 34-inch ultrawide panel also boosts text clarity
summary: Samsung Display has released a 34-inch ultrawide QD-OLED panel with a V-Stripe subpixel layout, improving text clarity, and reaching a peak brightness of 1,300 nits for the first time.

title: Get a Steelseries Rival 3 Wireless mouse for just $25, or 34% off the regular price
summary: Get a Steelseries Rival 3 Wireless mouse for just $25, or 34% off. The potent rodent is simple and executes flawlessly.

title: Forgotten Star Wars Racer Revenge game is key to jailbreaking PlayStation 5, price soars 1,900% overnight amid leaked ROM keys exploit
summary: Physical copies of the PS4 game have skyrocketed in price due to its essential role in the latest PlayStation 5 jailbreaks.

title: Micron secures $318 million Taiwanese subsidy for HBM R&D as AI memory arms race intensifies
summary: Micron secured NT$4.7 billion ($149 million) in Taiwanese subsidies to expand HBM research and development in Taiwan, aiming to develop leading-edge, high-performance memory.

title: Ukrainian soldier's M1 MacBook Air takes direct shrapnel hit, saving his life
summary: An Apple M1 MacBook Air laptop survived a shell shrapnel hit, still working despite damage to the screen and the letter K on the keyboard missing.

title: MSI teases new power supplies with 'instant protection' against melting RTX 5090 cables
summary: MSI has released two new power supplies with advanced protection against GPU overheating, particularly for the Nvidia RTX 5090. The power supplies monitor individual wires to prevent melting cables. MSI has attempted to solve this issue before, but this new design promises to be more effective.

title: Debian maintainer criticizes email-managed bug tracker as outdated for modern development
summary: A senior Debian maintainer has criticized the distribution's bug tracking system as outdated and increasingly unworkable for modern software development.

title: A deeper look at the tightened chipmaking supply chain, and where it may be headed in 2026
summary: The chipmaking ecosystem is facing constraints across the entire supply chain, with industry analysts stating that nobody is scaling up capacity. The industry remains conservative on capacity, leading to concerns about where the supply chain might be headed next.

title: How to use Plex and a spare computer to build a streaming movie service
summary: Build your own streaming service at home using a spare PC and a few hours to serve media across your home.

title: Reports of the previously-recalled Bambu Lab 3D printer being a fire hazard resurface, new power board component issue identified as the cause   Bambu says the A1's issue has been addressed, affected units replaced or repaired
summary: Reports of the recalled Bambu Lab 3D printer resurfacing due to a new power board component issue, with users claiming the AC board is flawed and should be recalled.

title: LG says it's launching the world's lightest 17-inch RTX laptop, also announces 16-inch ultra-portable laptop with 'dual-AI' functionality
summary: LG announced a 17-inch laptop that fits in the form factor of a 16-inch model while still sporting an RTX 5050 discrete GPU.

title: Get 25% off a vibrant MSI 4K QD-OLED gaming monitor with blistering 240Hz refresh rate   now $772, panel offers 3-year burn-in warranty in new year offer
summary: The MSI MPG 321URX QD-OLED gaming monitor is on sale for $772.99, a 25% discount from its usual price.

title: The Patriot Viper PV593 4TB SSD Review The Viper stays sleeping
summary: The Patriot Viper PV593 is perfectly good on paper and delivers satisfactory marks but doesn't quite close the deal.

title: AMD closes in on Intel in latest Steam Hardware Survey
summary: AMD is gaining on Intel, with user numbers increasing in the last month of 2025, while gamers are opting for 32GB of memory or more amid a memory crunch.

title: Dev uses Claude AI to write a functional NES emulator you can test it now, playing Donkey Kong in your browser
summary: A developer has successfully used Claude AI to write a functional NES emulator, allowing users to play Donkey Kong in their browser.

title: LG's dual-mode 4K 240Hz / 1080p 480Hz OLED gaming monitor is 42% off   premium flagship panel with HDR1300 drops to its lowest-ever price
summary: The LG 32GX870A-B is a 32-inch gaming monitor that supports 4K 240Hz and 1080p 480Hz, has HDR1300 and MLA+ panel, and webOS.

title: China's president Xi Jinping calls Taiwan reunification "unstoppable"   military drills around the island escalate in area and deployments
summary: China calls Taiwan reunification unstoppable as military drills proceed.

title: Americans lost $333 million to Bitcoin ATM fraud in 2025
summary: Americans lost $333 million to scams via crypto ATMs, with a constant rise in victims from 2020 to 2025, according to the FBI.

title: Chinese enthusiast overclocks AMD's Ryzen 7 9800X3D to 7.33GHz on Colorful X870E Vulcan motherboard  New world record achieved using liquid nitrogen cooling
summary: A Chinese overclocker named 'Hero' achieved a new world record clock speed of 7.335 MHz on AMD's Ryzen 7 9800X3D CPU using a Colorful iGame X870E Vulcan motherboard and liquid nitrogen cooling.

title: Nintendo's SNES cartridges get a USB-C adapter for playing, backing up, and validation
summary: Epilogue has announced the pre-order for SN Operator, a USB-C adapter that allows playing and backing up SNES game libraries to computers. It supports Windows, macOS, and Linux, and is set to ship in April. The adapter costs $59.

title: U.S. allows TSMC to import chipmaking equipment to its China fabs   Samsung, SK hynix likewise receive go signal from Commerce Department
summary: The U.S. Department of Commerce has allowed TSMC, Samsung, and SK hynix to import chipmaking equipment containing U.S. tech into their Chinese fabs, requiring annual licenses.

title: NES-a-like mini PC brings modern chips to the classic Nintendo case design
summary: A mini PC with an AMD Ryzen AI 9 HX 370 CPU and Radeon 890M iGPU is coming soon, resembling the classic Nintendo case design.

title: PlayStation 5 ROM keys leaked   jailbreaking could be made easier with BootROM codes
summary: The PlayStation 5's ROM keys have allegedly been leaked, potentially making jailbreaking easier, but other security features still need to be overcome.

title: Better safety features make laser engravers more popular than ever - a guide to the ins and outs of laser engraving and cutting
summary: Upgraded safety systems make modern lasers easier to trust and easier to recommend.

title: ID-Cooling FX360 LCD Review: Quiet, cool, and  why is this screen so small?
summary: ID-Cooling upgraded its FX360 with an LCD screen for $10 more, but its 1.48-inch screen may be too small to be useful.

title: ARPANET standardized TCP/IP on this day in 1983
summary: On January 1, 1983, ARPANET system architects initiated the cutover from the existing NCP to TCP/IP on all hosts, setting the foundations for today's Internet.

title: ASRock to enter AIO liquid cooling market with an intriguing pumpless design at CES
summary: ASRock will debut its AIO liquid coolers at CES 2026, featuring LCD screens and a pumpless design, while also offering more traditional options.

title: Huawei's Ascend and Kunpeng progress shows how China is rebuilding an AI compute stack under sanctions
summary: Huawei highlighted progress across its Ascend AI and Kunpeng CPU ecosystems, including the rollout of Atlas 900 supernodes and rapid growth in domestic developer adoption.

title: Finnish authorities seize ship and crew after undersea cable cut, pursuing criminal charges
summary: Finnish special forces boarded a ship, detaining all 14 crew members after an undersea cable was cut. This incident is the fourth damage to cables and pipelines in the Gulf of Finland in less than 1.5 years.

title: Logitech's legendary G502 Hero gaming mouse plummets to an irresistible $15.99
summary: Target is offering the Logitech G502 Hero for $35.99 with a complimentary $20 gift card, effectively bringing the cost down to $15.99.

title: UK company shoots a 1,000-degree furnace into space to study off-world chip manufacturing
summary: British startup Space Forge successfully turned on its first in-orbit furnace, reaching 1,000 degrees Celsius, a crucial step towards studying chip manufacturing in space.

title: Musk to expand xAI's training capacity to a monstrous 2 gigawatts with third building at Memphis site
summary: Elon Musk has announced that xAI will expand its compute power to 2 gigawatts with a third building at its Memphis site.

title: Nvidia's CUDA Tile examined: AI giant releases programming style for Rubin, Feynman, and beyond tensor-native execution model lays the foundation for Blackwell and beyond
summary: Nvidia's CUDA 13.1 introduces CUDA Tile, a new tile-centric programming path that elevates GPU kernel development. This innovation aligns CUDA with the tensor-native execution model of Blackwell-class GPUs. It lays the software foundation for future architectures.

title: GL.iNet Comet 5G A KVM over IP solution with 5G RedCap Cellular connectivity, 3.69-inch touchscreen display
summary: The GL.iNet Comet 5G is a KVM over IP solution with 5G RedCap cellular connectivity, a 3.69-inch touchscreen display, and features such as HDMI input, output, and USB ports. It boasts a quad-core CPU, 1GB DDR3L memory, and 64GB eMMC flash storage. The device enables remote access even when the regular internet connection is down.

title: Openterface KVM-GO   An ultra-compact KVM-over-USB solution with HDMI, DP, or VGA video input
summary: Openterface KVM-GO is a small, open-source KVM-over-USB gadget that can be connected directly to a target device. It supports HDMI, DisplayPort, or VGA video input and has a microSD card slot for OS installation. The device follows the company's earlier Mini-KVM device.

title: Allwinner V861 dual-core 64-bit RISC-V AI Camera SiP features 128MB DDR3L, 4K H.265/H.264 video encoder
summary: Allwinner V861 is a dual-core 32-bit/64-bit RISC-V SiP with 128MB DDR3L, designed for 4K AI camera applications. It features a 1 TOPS AI NPU, 4K H.264/H.265 video encoder, and supports various interfaces for camera, display, and storage.

title: WCH CH32H417 dual-core RISC-V MCU offers USB 3.0, 500MB/s UHSIF, and Fast Ethernet interfaces
summary: The WCH CH32H417 is a dual-core RISC-V microcontroller with a clock speed of up to 400 MHz, featuring 960 KB flash, 896 KB SRAM, and various high-speed interfaces.

title: Cincoze MD-3000 is a scalable DIN-Rail computer with up to 14th Gen 24-core Intel Core i9-14900 CPU
summary: The Cincoze MD-3000 is a high-performance, scalable DIN-Rail computer powered by Intel processors, supporting up to 96GB DDR5 memory, multiple storage options, and various interfaces. It targets vision-driven smart manufacturing applications. The computer can be expanded with up to six modules through the Scalable Expansion Deck.

title: Year 2025 in Review, CNX Software stats, and looking ahead to 2026
summary: The year 2025 saw the release of several notable products, including the Raspberry Pi 500+ mechanical keyboard, a 5-inch variant of the Raspberry Pi Touch Display 2, and a Raspberry Pi 5 1GB RAM. Third-party accessories continued to be released for Raspberry Pi SBC and Pico boards. The 12-core CIX P1 Armv9 SoC was a notable Arm SoC release.

title: VisionFive 2 Lite SBC Review Ubuntu 24.04 on a low-cost RISC-V SBC in 2026
summary: VisionFive 2 Lite is a low-cost RISC-V SBC that is a variant of the earlier VisionFive 2 SBC, and it has been reviewed with Ubuntu 24.04 to see the progress made on the software side since its initial release.

title: DFRobot HUSKYLENS 2 AI camera review
summary: The DFRobot HUSKYLENS 2 is an AI vision sensor with a Kendryte K230 dual-core RISC-V SoC and 6 TOPS AI accelerator, running machine vision algorithms fully on-device with built-in AI models and custom-trained model support.

title: Add four Gigabit or 2.5Gbps Ethernet ports to the Raspberry Pi 5 with this expansion board
summary: This expansion board connects four RJ45 ports to the Raspberry Pi 5's PCIe interface, providing Gigabit or 2.5Gbps Ethernet ports with status LEDs and no need for an external power supply. The board is plug-and-play and supports Raspberry Pi OS out of the box. The limiting factor is the Pi's PCIe Gen2/Gen3 x1 interface.

title: Rockchip RK1820/RK1828 SO-DIMM and M.2 LLM/VLM AI accelerator modules, devkits, and benchmarks
summary: Rockchip unveiled RK182X LLM/VLM accelerators, a development kit is now available, and the RK1828 has been benchmarked against the Rockchip RK3588's NPU.

title: Elecrow AI starter kit turns NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano into a learning platform with 11.6-inch display, 30 electronics modules
summary: Elecrow AI Starter Kit turns the NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano into a learning and educational kit with an 11.6-inch IPS touchscreen, 8MP camera, and 30 common electronics modules.

title: Open-source hardware USB to GPIB adapter connects legacy GPIB/IEEE-488 instruments to modern hosts
summary: The UsbGpib is an open-source hardware, inexpensive, and portable USB to GPIB adapter that connects legacy GPIB/IEEE-488 instruments to modern hosts. It uses a Microchip ATMega32U4 microcontroller and supports USBTMC and IEEE-488.1 and 488.2 standards.

title: LoRa, BLE, and GNSS tracker supports open-source software, solar charging, outdoor and indoor tracking
summary: The TD04 is a LoRa-based low-power tracker that supports both indoor and outdoor positioning, featuring automatic switching between GNSS and BLE for optimized accuracy and power usage.

title: Rockchip RK628D based HDMI-to-MIPI-CSI board converts HDMI video into camera feed for embedded systems
summary: The Firefly HDMI-to-MIPI-CSI board converts an HDMI input into a MIPI-CSI camera stream for embedded systems, supporting resolutions up to 4K @ 60fps and 4K @ 30fps output.

title: Forlinx FET1126Bx-S low-power Rockchip RV1126BJ industrial SoM powers SBC with 40-pin GPIO header
summary: Forlinx has released the FET1126Bx-S, a low-power SoM based on the Rockchip RV1126B/RV1126BJ SoC, designed for edge AI applications with local video analytics, low power consumption, and long-term stability.

title: Bit-Brick Cluster K1 A 4-slot RISC-V cluster board for SpacemiT K1-based SSOM-K1 system-on-module
summary: The Bit-Brick Cluster K1 is a 4-slot RISC-V cluster board designed for edge computing, AI workloads, and high-performance embedded applications. It features an onboard Gigabit Ethernet switch chip, USB ports, and a 3-pin fan power header. The cluster board uses the SpacemiT K1 octa-core RISC-V processor and supports up to 8GB dual-channel LPDDR4X memory.

title: ESP32-C6 development board features 1.8-inch AMOLED touch display, built-in mic and speaker, IMU, RTC, and more
summary: The Waveshare ESP32-C6-Touch-AMOLED-1.8 is a touch display development board featuring a 1.8-inch capacitive AMOLED display, 6-axis IMU, RTC, audio codec, and more. It's based on the ESP32-C6 wireless SoC with Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5 LE, and Zigbee connectivity. Typical applications include smart home control panels and wearable IoT devices.

title: M5Stack NanoH2 An ultra-compact ESP32-H2 IoT development kit with Zigbee, Thread, and Matter connectivity
summary: M5Stack NanoH2 is an ultra-compact, standalone IoT development kit powered by Espressif Systems ESP32-H2 wireless SoC with support for Zigbee, Thread, and Matter, designed for smart home and low-power wireless applications.

title: OpenMediaVault 8 (OMV8)  Synchrony released for 64-bit x86 (AMD64) and Arm (ARM64) platforms only
summary: OpenMediaVault 8 (OMV8) has been released, supporting only 64-bit architectures, dropping 32-bit systems. It's a popular open-source NAS solution based on Debian Linux. The main reason for killing 32-bit support is that the Salt Project only supports 64-bit builds.

title: Cerelog ESP-EEG  A low-cost ESP32-based EEG acquisition board for brain computer interface (BCI) experiments
summary: The Cerelog ESP-EEG is an 8-channel low-cost brain computer interface (BCI) circuit board for EEG data acquisition. It connects to a host system over USB-C and supports various applications. The board has an active noise-removal bias pin for reduced mains interference.

title: Jetway B903DMTX Intel N97 fanless industrial box PC features 10 USB ports, four DB9 serial interfaces
summary: Jetway B903DMTX is a fanless industrial box PC with Intel N97 quad-core Alder Lake-N CPU, 10 USB ports, 4 DB9 serial ports, and support for M.2 wireless modules.

title: Firefly CAM-3576 series  Tiny Rockchip RK3576 SBCs for commercial, industrial, and automotive applications
summary: Firefly Technology has introduced the CAM-3576 series of tiny SBCs based on the Rockchip RK3576 processor with a 6 TOPS NPU for AIoT, edge AI, smart vision, industrial, and automotive applications.

title: CrowPi 3 AI Learning Kit is powered by a Raspberry Pi 5 SBC, works with Arduino Nano, BBC Micro:bit, and Raspberry Pi Pico boards
summary: The CrowPi 3 is a learning and development kit featuring 41 built-in modules and over 150 lessons, compatible with Raspberry Pi 5, and focused on Artificial Intelligence (AI) learning.

title: Lattice Semi MachXO4 FPGA family offers up to 9400 LUTs, 448 kb user flash, improved hot socketing
summary: Lattice Semiconductor has launched the MachXO4 low-power FPGA family featuring up to 9400 LUTs, 448 kb user flash, and improved hot socketing.

title: 4-inch round HDMI display offers USB touchscreen for Raspberry Pi, AIDA64, Smart Home, Art projects
summary: VIEWE launched a 4-inch round HDMI display with 720x720 resolution and a USB touchscreen function suitable for SBCs, PCs, Smart Home, and Art projects.

title: Auvidea X242 An NVIDIA Jetson Thor T5000 industrial carrier board with dual 10GbE, PCIe x16, CSI-2 camera support
summary: Auvidea X242 is an industrial carrier board for NVIDIA's Jetson Thor T5000 module, supporting dual 10GbE, PCIe x16 expansion, and multiple cameras through a 16-lane CSI-2 camera connector.

title: HackyPi 2.0 hacking tool gets ESP32-S3 for Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connectivity (Crowdfunding)
summary: HackyPi 2.0 is an ESP32-S3-based USB hacking tool that adds Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connectivity, remote access, and AI integration, making it more flexible than the original Raspberry Pi RP2040-based HackyPi.

title: CrowPanel Advanced 7inch Review  Part 1: ESP32-P4 HMI AI display hands-on with LVGL factory firmware
summary: Elecrow sent a CrowPanel Advanced 7inch ESP32-P4 HMI display for review, designed for high-performance AI and IoT applications with a 2MP camera and various wireless modules. The review will cover unboxing, hardware check, and testing with preinstalled firmware using LVGL and AI features. The kit supports Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.3, Zigbee, Thread, Matter, and LoRa connectivity.

title: ESP-Scope is a web-based oscilloscope built using the ESP-IDF framework and Gemini 3 LLM
summary: ESP-Scope is an open-source firmware transforming ESP32 boards into web-based oscilloscopes with features like real-time signal visualization, adjustable sample rate, and trigger level.

title: GigaDevice GD32VW553-UNIFI A $2+ WiFi 6 and Bluetooth 5.2 LE wireless IoT module
summary: The GigaDevice GD32VW553-UNIFI is a low-cost wireless IoT module with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth 5.2 LE connectivity, featuring a GigaDevice GD32VW553 RISC-V microcontroller and 18 GPIOs.

title: ESP32-S3 AIoT Basic A learning and prototyping kit with camera, audio, LCD, and sensors
summary: The ESP32-S3 AIoT Basic is a low-cost, learning, and prototyping kit with a range of AIoT peripherals, including a camera, audio, LCD, and sensors.

title: Forlinx FCU3011 An NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano fanless industrial computer with 4x GbE, optional 4G/5G and Wi-Fi connectivity
summary: Forlinx Embedded has released the FCU3011, a compact, fanless industrial AI edge computer built around the NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano, designed for 24/7 operations in various industries. It supports NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano configurations with 4GB/8GB memory and a 128GB SSD. The system features various interfaces and power options for industrial applications.
